title: Abuse victim, who was raped by more than 500 men, was the one prosecuted by police
text:
An abuse victim who was raped by more than 500 men from the age of 11 in a horrific ordeal lasting seven years speaks out for the first time.

The woman, who goes by the alias of Jennifer, claims that police did not take action and instead arrested her for prostitution on multiple occasions.

Jennifer, now in her 40s, had 52 convictions in total before the age of 19.

This is the latest in a list of harrowing stories from victims of the Telford sex abuse scandal.

A woman, who goes by the alias of Jennifer, was raped by more than 500 men from the age of 11 in a horrific ordeal lasting seven years (stock image)

In the Shropshire town, a brutal sex gang targeted the innocent girls over a 40-year period in what may be Britain's 'worst ever' child abuse scandal.

Girls were drugged, beaten and raped at the hands of the violent groom gang which was active since the 1980s.

Three people were murdered and two others died following incidents linked to the sickening scandal.

Jennifer, who is now a mother, told the Sunday Mirror that she was only 11 when a boy she was seeing introduced her to an older relative whose friends gang raped her.

This is the latest in a list of harrowing stories from victims of the Telford sex abuse scandal. In the Shropshire town, a brutal sex gang targeted the innocent girls over a 40-year period in what may be Britain's 'worst ever' child abuse scandal

At the height of her ordeal, her trafficker arrived at her home with a shotgun.

She did not attend school between the ages of 14 and 16 because of the abuse she suffered at the hands of up to 10 men every night.

Jennifer said: 'I thought the only way out was death because I'd gone to the police and they didn't want to help me. My life was a living hell, I felt so alone.'

She said that authorities did not ask her enough questions about why she was skipping school.

When she did go back to class, a teacher said she had missed too much for it to benefit her.

Jennifer, who is now a mother, told the Sunday Mirror that she was only 11 when a boy she was seeing introduced her to an older relative whose friends gang raped her

After this, she was groomed by an older man who took her up and down the country to be raped by strangers. If she didn't do what he said, Jennifer said he would beat her.

She said: 'He also locked me in a flat with iron bars, for three or four days. I was told the police thought I'd been abducted but they did nothing.'

Her trafficker spent four months in custody on suspicion of gang rape, but then came to her home with a gun when his case was dropped.

Jennifer will give evidence at the public inquiry which is ongoing.

West Mercia Police said officer's couldn't identify the offenders, so her case was not successful.

But a spokesperson told The Sunday Mirror that the case would be pursued in depth 'if more information were to come to light'.

West Midlands Police did not have a record of the complaint made by Jennifer when she was 17, but said it takes all allegations of historic sex abuse seriously.

Telford and Wrekin Council said evidence should be given, from anyone with information, to the ongoing public inquiry.
description: The woman, who goes by the alias of Jennifer, had 52 convictions in total before the age of 19. This is the latest in a list of harrowing stories from victims of the Telford sex abuse scandal.
